rationale: First-person practitioner account of using Claude Sonnet for vibe coding, describes problems encountered, specific workflow
title: GitHub - codervisor/lean-spec: Lightweight, flexible Spec-Driven Development
content: Earlier this year, I was amazed by agentic AI coding with Claude Sonnet 3.7. The term 'vibe coding' hadn't been coined yet, but that's exactly what I was doing—letting AI generate code while I steered the conversation. It felt magical. Until it didn't. After a few weeks, I noticed patterns: code redundancy creeping in, intentions drifting from my original vision, and increasing rework as the AI forgot context between sessions.

rationale: Practitioner describes switching from vibe coding to spec-driven development, includes workflow details, time comparisons, metrics
title: From Vibe Coding to Spec-Driven Development in Kiro IDE
content: When I first used Kiro a few months ago, I was focused entirely on vibe coding. It was fun, but chaotic. Now, after experimenting with spec-driven development (SDD), I'm completely blown away! This time, I built a full-featured Agile Planning application with real-time collaboration, GitHub integration, and a collaborative whiteboard. Development Time Comparison: Vibe Coding 90h total vs Spec-Driven 50h total. Time Saved 40 hours (44%)

rationale: First-person reflection on using agentic AI coding, describes mental model changes, cognitive load shifts
title: Ask HN: What has been your experience with Agentic Coding?
content: I have been experimenting more deeply with agentic coding, and it's made me rethink how I approach building software. One key difference I have noticed is the upfront cost. With agentic coding, I felt a higher upfront cost: I have to think architecture, constraints, and success criteria before the model even starts generating code. What I have realized is that agentic coding shifts my cognitive load from on-demand execution to more pre-planned execution.

rationale: Practitioner comparing AI models for agentic coding in Claude Code, describes real-world experience with specific tools
title: Deepseek v3.2 vs GLM 4.6 vs Minimax M2 for agentic coding use
content: In my experience (within Claude Code), Minimax M2 is good for what it is; an efficient, compact, and effective tool-calling agent - but I feel it somewhat lacks the reasoning depth required for planning and executing complex problems. GLM 4.6, in my experience, seems to be like a more reliable choice to daily drive, and can handle more difficult tasks if properly guided - I'd say it's only slightly worse than Sonnet 4.5 in CC.

rationale: First-person tutorial describing using Claude Code for a specific engineering task with concrete outcome
title: How I Used Claude Code to Speed Up My Shell Startup by 95%
content: My terminal was sluggish. Every time I opened a new tab, there was this annoying delay before I could type. I used Claude Code to analyze and optimize my shell configuration, resulting in a 95% speedup.

title: Want the same milk and eggs? Instacart might charge you more than your neighbor
content: Instacart's artificial intelligence-enabled pricing may be increasing the cost of your groceries by as much as $1,200 a year, according to a new study. Instacart is an online grocery delivery service that uses its technology platform to fulfill orders through personal shoppers.

rationale: Medical AI for diagnosis, not engineering practice - v1 oracle hallucinated coding workflows
title: AI detects cancer but it's also reading who you are
content: AI tools designed to diagnose cancer from tissue samples are quietly learning more than just disease patterns. New research shows these systems can infer patient demographics from pathology slides, leading to biased results for certain groups.

content: As digital and intelligent technologies become increasingly intertwined, Digital and Intelligent Transformation (DIT) emerges as a key catalyst for advancing high-quality economic and social development. To evaluate the effects of DIT on corporate GI, the study employs the establishment of the National New Generation Artificial Intelligence...

rationale: Stock market mechanics article, not engineering - v1 oracle hallucinated ChatGPT/Copilot usage
title: Understanding Circuit Breakers: How Market Mechanics Prevent Panic
content: Circuit breakers pause trading during extreme volatility to prevent cascading sell orders. Implemented after 1987 crash, these mechanisms trigger at 10%, 25%, and 3% declines. Since introduction, circuit breakers have triggered 12 times, most recently in 2020.

rationale: Gaming news, completely unrelated to engineering AI usage
title: Kingmakers, the medieval battle game with modern weapons, has been delayed
content: Redemption Road's absolutely bonkers-looking medieval shooter, Kingmakers, was slated to launch in Early Access on October 8, but now its release has been pushed back with no new date in sight.

rationale: Tool FOR managing AI usage (privacy), not using AI in engineering work - v1 misclassified as HIGH
title: I built a local Privacy Firewall that sanitizes prompts before they hit Claude/ChatGPT
content: OP here. I built this because I recently caught myself almost pasting a block of logs containing AWS keys into Claude. The Problem: I need the reasoning capabilities of cloud models, but I can't trust myself not to accidentally leak PII or secrets. The Solution: A Chrome extension that acts as a local middleware.

rationale: Tool announcement without usage experience - v1 misclassified as HIGH
title: sst/opencode: AI coding agent, built for the terminal
content: AI coding agent, built for the terminal. Installation: curl -fsSL https://opencode.ai/install | bash. Features include multi-file editing, terminal integration, and Claude support. Star us on GitHub!

rationale: Building a tool FOR managing AI sessions, not using AI in engineering - describes Claude Code usage tangentially
title: Show HN: Contextify – Searchable History for Claude Code and Codex CLI
content: I built Contextify because I kept losing track of my Claude Code sessions. Contextify is a native macOS HUD - a private, searchable timeline of your AI coding sessions. Unified timeline of Claude Code and Codex CLI conversations.

title: In 5 minutes, I'll show you how to build AI agents from scratch
content: AI agents are among the most exciting areas of modern AI development. In this article, I will show you how to build your first AI agent from scratch using Google's ADK (Agent Development Kit).

rationale: Discussing which LLM to use, not actual engineering experience with AI tools
title: Best LLM under 30/40B for writing, chatting, talking
content: Hello everyone, I'm still a novice in these artificial intelligence issues. I was looking for a model to use mainly to chat, so maybe discuss topics, but a model that is specialized above all in the text.

rationale: FPGA engineer describes iterative workflow using GitHub Copilot for Verilog AXI4-Lite slave generation, includes specific prompts, refinements, and hardware testing on KR260
title: Writing Verilog code with Copilot
content: P. Trujillo began with skepticism about AI coding tools but found them valuable for generating auxiliary scripts. His methodology involved iterative prompting: Initial Request for 'an AXI4 Lite slave with 4 RW registers and 4 RO registers', then refinement loops addressing shortcomings. Copilot initially created internal register declarations rather than exposing them as module ports. After testing on KR260 board, his conclusion: 'anybody can generate an AXI4 Lite Slave, but just FPGA designers will make it work.' Success required both AI-assisted code generation and domain-specific expertise in hardware implementation.

rationale: Embedded software consultant (20yr experience) tests 5 AI tools for firmware development including ChatPDF for datasheets, ChatGPT for HAL generation, GitHub Copilot for code suggestions
title: Unveiling the Ultimate 5 AI Tools for Embedded Software Developers
content: Jacob Beningo explores five AI tools for embedded systems developers. ChatPDF tested with Microchip SAM-D5x-E5x datasheet for sleep mode queries. ChatGPT used for GPIO HAL interface generation - 'the junk drawer of AI because it's trained to do many things' but produces functional starter code. GitHub Copilot at $20/month provides real-time suggestions within VS Code. Copilot Labs offers code translation from Python to C. Beningo concludes these tools help 'automate code writing and debugging activities to help you write more robust code faster.'

rationale: FPGA developer describes 3-step workflow: algorithm research with ChatGPT, Python prototyping, then HDL translation. Includes specific example of square root function implementation.
title: Simplifying FPGA code development: How ChatGPT is changing the game
content: The article outlines a three-stage FPGA development process: 1) Algorithm Exploration with ChatGPT to brainstorm approaches, 2) Python Prototyping - 'Debug your code in Python, while making sure it keeps correct precision and expected output values', 3) HDL Conversion to VHDL/Verilog. ChatGPT commonly makes conversion errors: incorrect bit-width precision, signal mismatches, semantic mistakes (left-shift becomes right-shift). 'You achieve the best results when you and ChatGPT work together rather than expecting it to get it perfect.' GPT-4 shows superior understanding, generating pipelined implementations.

rationale: PCB designer tests ChatGPT for various design tasks, gives honest assessment: B grade for research, D- for engineering. Specific tests on calculations, component selection, code generation.
title: Can You Use ChatGPT for PCB Design?
content: Comprehensive evaluation of ChatGPT for PCB design tasks. Research Summarization: excels at compiling industry standards and engineering formulas. Code Generation: successfully produced Python for test equipment control. High-Level Design Guidance: problematic - provided nearly identical responses for high-speed, RF, and high-density PCBs. Engineering Calculations: inconsistent - 75% correct on RMS voltage but failed coplanar waveguide impedance. Component Recommendations: 'the weakest category' - recommended power amplifiers instead of transimpedance amplifiers. Grades: Research Tool B, Engineering Tool D-.

rationale: Industry overview of AI copilots in mechanical CAD - covers Fusion 360, SOLIDWORKS AURA, practical workflows for sketch cleanup, simulation setup, documentation. Describes real applications and limitations.
title: AI Copilots Are Rewiring Mechanical Design: What Engineers Need to Know
content: AI copilots in mechanical design aren't generic chatbots—they're specialized tools that interpret geometry, apply constraints, and suggest design improvements within CAD environments. Fusion 360's sketch auto-constrain feature demonstrates practical value by automatically applying constraints that align with mechanical design logic. AI systems can identify unrestrained degrees of freedom, suggest efficient mesh strategies, and propose load cases. SOLIDWORKS AURA AI Companion launched 2025. Key limitation: AI still struggles with ambiguous intent, loose sketches, and legacy assemblies. Success depends on clear communication—similar to mentoring a junior engineer.

rationale: Real practitioner discussion of using ChatGPT for 3D printing workflows - includes both positive and negative experiences, honest limitations.
title: Anyone using AI (like ChatGPT) in their 3D printing workflow?
content: User leaschaefer reports success with limited AI applications: getting quick help with G-code commands, troubleshooting suggestions, brainstorming design ideas. Emphasized: 'I don't rely on it as a final source of truth.' User 2AHumanRight had frustrating experience: uploaded filament test pictures and settings, AI could identify problems initially but iterative troubleshooting became circular. After 9 print attempts following AI suggestions, abandoned approach. Key limitation noted: 'AI can sometimes overcomplicate things because it doesn't see the printer's real conditions.'

rationale: Mechanical design engineer used GPT-4 and Claude for CAD tolerance review on Powertrain Mount Bracket, achieved 30% reduction in rework hours. Specific workflow described.
title: How I Used AI to Cut Design Rework by 30%
content: A mechanical design engineer used GPT-4 and Claude for CAD tolerance review, BOM + note checking, and pre-handoff validation on a Powertrain Mount Bracket system. Achieved 30% reduction in rework hours, fewer late-stage corrections, and tighter team handoffs. AI flagged issues like tool access for bolts hidden behind ribs and blind holes near flanges that could cause machining issues—things 'easy to overlook in a late-night review sprint' because the AI 'had no fatigue, no tunnel vision, and no deadlines.'

rationale: Structural engineer describes ChatGPT workflows for technical writing, report drafts, client communication. Includes limitations (factual errors, bias) and implementation recommendations.
title: ChatGPT in Structural Engineering
content: Stephanie Slocum examines how ChatGPT can transform structural engineering workflows, reducing time on writing tasks (20-40% of work hours). Use cases: explaining occupancy loads to clients, generating report first drafts from field notes, diplomatic client communications. Critical limitations: 'ChatGPT output was factually incorrect, sharing that I had attended MIT and Stanford' instead of Penn State. Advises starting with thought leadership content, developing QA/QC protocols before client reports.

rationale: Structural engineer built Claude-powered truss analysis agent. Describes 3-component architecture (flexible AI + validated tools + human oversight) for reliable engineering.
title: AI Agents for Civil Engineers
content: Structural engineer Anande Bergman developed a Claude-powered truss analysis agent. 'A traditional Python script needs exact coordinates, but an AI agent can look at a hand-drawn sketch or AutoCAD drawing and figure out the structure geometry by itself.' Agent extracts geometry from sketches, accesses material databases, solves optimization problems. Three-component architecture: flexible AI + validated engineering tools + human oversight. Provides open-source code for engineers.

rationale: Automotive engineers at BMW, Mercedes-Benz using Monolith AI for testing optimization. Specific results: 70% reduction in track testing, 45% cost reduction.
title: Monolith AI for Automotive Engineering
content: Automotive engineers use Monolith AI to optimize testing. European vehicle manufacturer discovered 'half a million USD in testing waste' analyzing 500+ battery cells. Customers report 'up to 70% reduction in track testing time, plus 45% reduction in costs.' AI accelerates calibration testing 'up to 20x faster.' Works with BMW Group, Nissan, Mercedes-Benz, Honda. Supports validation, calibration, anomaly detection for battery and acoustic engineering.
